Package src.model.game

Class QuartoBoard

java.lang.Object
src.model.game.QuartoBoard
public class QuartoBoard extends Object
The QuartoBoard class represents the game board for a game of Quarto. It manages the state of the game board, available pawns, selected pawn, and provides methods for checking winning situations.

    Constructs a new QuartoBoard object.

  • Constructor Details

    • QuartoBoard

      public QuartoBoard()
      Constructs a new QuartoBoard object. Initializes the game board, available pawns, and sets up a new game.

  • Method Details

    • getSelectedPawn

      public QuartoPawn getSelectedPawn()
      Retrieves the currently selected pawn.
      Returns:
      The currently selected QuartoPawn, or null if no pawn is selected.

    • setSelectedPawn

      public void setSelectedPawn​(QuartoPawn pawn)
      Sets the selected pawn on the board.
      Parameters:
      pawn - The QuartoPawn to set as selected.

    • getPawnAtPosition

      public QuartoPawn getPawnAtPosition​(int line, int column)
      Retrieves the pawn at the specified position on the game board.
      Parameters:
      line - The row index.
      column - The column index.
      Returns:
      The QuartoPawn at the specified position.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified position is invalid.

    • getTable

      public QuartoPawn[][] getTable()
      Retrieves the current state of the game board.
      Returns:
      A 2D array of QuartoPawn objects representing the game board.

    • setTable

      public void setTable​(int i, int j, QuartoPawn pawn)
      Sets the pawn at the specified position on the game board.
      Parameters:
      i - The row index.
      j - The column index.
      pawn - The QuartoPawn to set at the specified position.

    • isTableEmpty

      public boolean isTableEmpty​(int line, int column)
      Checks if the specified position on the game board is empty.
      Parameters:
      line - The row index.
      column - The column index.
      Returns:
      True if the position is empty, false otherwise.

    • getPawnAvailable

      public QuartoPawn[] getPawnAvailable()
      Retrieves the array of available pawns.
      Returns:
      An array of QuartoPawn objects representing available pawns.

    • isPawnListEmpty

      public boolean isPawnListEmpty()
      Checks if the list of available pawns is empty.
      Returns:
      True if the list of available pawns is empty, false otherwise.

    • winSituation

      public boolean winSituation​(int line, int column)
      Checks if a winning situation occurs after placing a pawn at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      line - The line index.
      column - The column index.
      Returns:
      True if a winning situation occurs, false otherwise.

    • getWinLine

      public List<int[]> getWinLine()
      Retrieves the list of win lines on the game board. Each win line is represented by an array of integers containing the indices of the winning positions.
      Returns:
      A list of arrays representing the win lines.

    • getLines

      public QuartoPawn[][] getLines()
      Retrieves the rows of the game board.
      Returns:
      A 2D array of QuartoPawn objects representing the rows of the game board.

    • getColumns

      public QuartoPawn[][] getColumns()
      Retrieves the columns of the game board.
      Returns:
      A 2D array of QuartoPawn objects representing the columns of the game board.

    • getDiagonals

      public QuartoPawn[][] getDiagonals()
      Retrieves the diagonals of the game board.
      Returns:
      A 2D array of QuartoPawn objects representing the diagonals of the game board.

    • getWin

      public QuartoWin getWin()
      Retrieves the QuartoWin object responsible for managing win conditions on the game board.
      Returns:
      The QuartoWin object.
